New Records: Willy Adames tied the MLB record for most three-run home runs in a single season with 13, matching Ken Griffey Jr.'s record from 1996.
Key Match Events: The Milwaukee Brewers defeated the St. Louis Cardinals 9-3 on Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: The Brewers' victory marked a strong performance by Willy Adames, who is now expected to be one of the most sought-after infielders on the open market.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adames has more three-run home runs than five entire teams this year.
Others: Willy Adames' contract is set to expire this fall, and it remains to be seen if the Milwaukee Brewers will pay to keep his powerful bat in town.
